F378
VINDICATION 2016 2021 2023 (longitudinal pattern)
VERIFIED

SCDS Symptoms Dismissed as Psychiatric Despite 2016 ENT History

PATTERN FINDING: Patient's ear/hearing symptoms were dismissed as psychiatric despite: (1) 2016-2017: Laboratory-confirmed polymicrobial ear infections (Candida + Pseudomonas), 2 mastoiditis episodes requiring IV treatment, 12+ months continuous ear disease; (2) May 2021: ENT team identified SCDS - "a hole in his skull" - the ORGANIC cause of autophony (hearing internal sounds including eye movements, heartbeat); (3) Despite SCDS diagnosis, Dr Bulale referred to NHNN FND service May 2021 - attempting psychiatric label; (4) Feb 2023: SCDS surgery performed, vindicating symptoms as structural. The "hearing eyeballs move" phenomenon is AUTOPHONY - a documented symptom of Superior Canal Dehiscence Syndrome, not psychiatric illness.

F373
QUANTUM Feb 2016 - Jan 2017
VERIFIED

Protracted Treatment-Resistant Ear Infections (Feb 2016 - Jan 2017)

Related: F049 F049a F049b F118 +3 more
FINDINGS_REGISTRY View Details
F376
QUANTUM Feb-Aug 2016
VERIFIED

Candida + Pseudomonas: Multi-Organism Refractory Ear Disease (2016)

Ear swab cultures confirmed two distinct pathogens: (1) Candida species isolated 03/02/2016 and 23/08/2016. (2) Pseudomonas aeruginosa documented in ENT letter 07/06/2016 (CL050). Polymicrobial pattern explains treatment resistance. Pseudomonas otitis externa is notoriously difficult - required quinolone drops (Ofloxacin).

Related: F049 F373 F374 F061
FINDINGS_REGISTRY View Details
F377
CAUSATION 07 Nov 2016
VERIFIED

Torticollis/Cervical Radiculopathy Following Ear Infections (Nov 2016)

MSK Physio Simon Jenner documented 07/11/2016: "Ongoing pain in neck and L arm following ear infection. Worse when looking up." Diagnosed cervical radiculopathy with decreased cervical flexion/extension, glove-like sensory loss in L forearm, weaker grip. John's 2024 eConsult confirms: "followed episode of torticolis from ear infections/mastoiditis." Establishes documented causal link between 2016 ear infections and cervical spine sequelae.

Finding Categories

View Evidence Tiers
VINDICATION

Independent specialists confirming diagnoses were inappropriate or removing psychiatric labels

BREACH

Potential Bolam/Bolitho breach of duty by healthcare providers

DISCREPANCY

GP entries contradicting contemporaneous medical evidence

WITNESS

Third-party corroboration of events from family or clinicians

CAUSATION

Evidence linking breach of duty to patient harm

FABRICATION

Entries impossible given known facts or timeline

PROCEDURAL

Administrative failures and data protection issues

QUANTUM

Evidence supporting damages calculation

Evidence Status Key

VERIFIED
Confirmed by independent documentary evidence
SUPPORTED
Consistent with evidence but not definitively proven
CONTRADICTED
Evidence disproves this claim
